paragraphs.text:
%md

## OML4Py Feature Selection: Supervised Algorithm

In this notebook, we demonstrate how to perform feature selection using in-database supervised algorithms via OML4Py.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

We build a random forest model to predict whether the customer by insurance or not, then use feature importance to perform feature selection. 

Copyright (c) 2020 Oracle Corporation                             
###### [The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0](https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl/)
---

msg.data:
OML4Py Feature Selection: Supervised Algorithm

In this notebook, we demonstrate how to perform feature selection using in-database supervised algorithms via OML4Py.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

We build a random forest model to predict whether the customer by insurance or not, then use feature importance to perform feature selection.

Copyright (c) 2020 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: Import libraries and set display options
paragraphs.text:
%python

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

import pandas as pd
import oml
from oml import automl

pd.set_option('display.max_rows', 500)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', 500)
pd.set_option('display.width', 1000)

paragraphs.title: Create Train and Test (60/40 split) datasets
paragraphs.text:
%python

TRAIN, TEST = CUST_INSUR_LTV_DF.split(ratio = (0.6,0.4))
TRAIN_X     = TRAIN.drop('BUY_INSURANCE')
TRAIN_Y     = TRAIN['BUY_INSURANCE']
TEST_X      = TEST
TEST_Y      = TEST['BUY_INSURANCE']

paragraphs.title: Apply Attribute Importance algorithm to obtain the attribute importance
paragraphs.text:
%python

setting = {'ODMS_SAMPLING':'ODMS_SAMPLING_DISABLE'}
ai_mod = oml.ai(**setting)
ai_mod = ai_mod.fit(TRAIN_X, TRAIN_Y, case_id = 'CUSTOMER_ID')
z.show(ai_mod.importance.round(4))

paragraphs.title: Build a Random Forest Model to predict who will purchase insurance
paragraphs.text:
%python

settings = dict()
rf_mod = oml.rf(**settings)
rf_mod.fit(TRAIN_X, TRAIN_Y, case_id = 'CUSTOMER_ID')
